title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.26-27 | 9-10-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyananjani Shalakaya Chaksharan Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and paying respects to the spiritual master and Krishna.

segments.key_quote: He is called undisturbed, Dheera, who goes to an unknown remote place and freed from all obligations quits his material body when it has become useless.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 26th verse of the 13th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining its meaning about leaving the body in a remote place when it becomes useless, and Vidura's advice to Dhritarashtra.

segments.key_quote: One who has spoiled his life without such cultural activities is advised to leave home without knowledge of friends and relatives, and being thus freed from all obligations of family, society, country, etc., give up the body at some unknown destination.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Srila Prabhupada's purport on the verse, emphasizing the importance of devotional service in human life and the recommendation for those who haven't engaged in it to leave home and give up the body in an unknown place.

segments.key_quote: Quit home is possible only for a dhira. Dhira means undisturbed. This is however the path of renunciation based on a frustrated life is for those who are unable to take to devotional service and are experiencing the miserable conditions especially in old age.
segments.summary: The speaker continues explaining Prabhupada's purport, defining 'dhira' as one who is undisturbed and can give up family life, and clarifying that this path of renunciation is for those frustrated with material life and unable to take up devotional service.

segments.key_quote: But stabilization of such renunciation is possible only by association with bona fide saints and self-realized souls by which one can be engaged in the loving devotional service of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that renunciation alone is not enough; association with devotees and engaging in devotional service under proper guidance are crucial for stabilization and liberation, highlighting Dhritarashtra's fortune in having Vidura's association.

segments.key_quote: He is certainly a first class man who awakens and understands either by himself or from others the falsity and misery of this material world and thus leaves home and depends fully on the personality of Godhead residing within his heart
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 27th verse, explaining that the best course of action is to understand the falsity of material existence through enlightenment from devotees and depend fully on Krishna within the heart when renouncing the world.

segments.key_quote: The third division of transcendentalist is a sincere devotee of the Lord who awakens God consciousness by hearing and chanting and leaves home depending completely on the personality of Godhead who resides in his heart.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses three divisions of transcendentalists, highlighting that the highest is the sincere devotee who awakens God consciousness through hearing and chanting and depends on Krishna in the heart when renouncing.

segments.key_quote: Krishna resides in our heart is Paramatma. Everybody's heart. And he is always there. So he is our top most well wisher. He is our best guide. He is most dependable.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes Krishna's presence as Paramatma in everyone's heart, highlighting His role as the ultimate guide and protector, and stressing the importance of practicing devotional service to achieve self-realization.

segments.key_quote: If at all you want to be able to fully depend on Krishna towards the end of your life, then prepare, begin preparation for it now by associating with devotees and practicing chanting, hearing about Krishna's holy name, Krishna's qualities, Krishna's pastimes described in the Bhagavatam, etc.
segments.summary: The speaker provides practical instructions on how to prepare for depending on Krishna by associating with devotees, chanting, and hearing about Krishna, emphasizing that seeking material benefits hinders true God consciousness.

segments.key_quote: So it is best to practice devotional service before quitting home or before the death comes and having practiced actually execute devotional service depending on Krishna in all circumstances and thereby perfecting one's life.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating the importance of practicing devotional service before renouncing or facing death, emphasizing that depending on Krishna in all circumstances leads to perfection.
